data.title: Sydney shivers through coldest June morning in 13 years
data.meta_description: Sydney has shivered through its coldest June morning since 2010, with temperatures going down to 5.2C.
data.text:
Sydney has shivered through its coldest June morning since 2010, with temperatures plummeting to 5.2 degrees.

It comes as a slow-moving high pressure system resulted in clear skies, combining with a lingering cold and dry air mass.

The pattern created colder than usual conditions stretching from Tasmania to southern Queensland.

In the southwest suburbs, the mercury went even lower, with Campbelltown registering -1.6 degrees.

As cold as Sydney was, its icy temperature was beaten by Newcastle, with the city registering its coldest morning in 23 years, at 4.3 degrees.

But Canberra trumped them both, with its -7.2 low the coldest since 2018, and the coldest June morning since 1986.

Five-year lows were also recorded in Bathurst, Mudgee, Orange, Dubbo, Casino and Gayndah.

And Perisher Valley recorded Australia's lowest June temperature since 2018, getting down to -10 degrees.

In Victoria's Mount Hotham, temperatures got down to -7.2.

In Queensland's Applethorpe, the mercury slumped to -3.5.

Liawenee recorded Tasmania's lowest temperature at -6.3.

Tomorrow also marks the winter solstice, the shortest day of the year, with the sun returning for longer and longer stretches in the sky.

Meanwhile, South Australia is bracing for moderate to heavy rain from tomorrow as a system rolls east over Western Australia, Weatherzone reported.

Adelaide is e xpected to receive up to 40mm of rain between 9am Thursday and 9am Friday, with isolated falls of up to 70mm.

Winds of up to 75-85km/hr are also expected, which could be dangerous in combination with the rain loosening the roots of trees, Weatherzone warned.

Adelaide hit with city's wettest November day in nearly 60 years

Sydney today is forecast to range from six to 16 degrees, with clear skies.

Melbourne will be cloudy, ranging from four to 12 degrees.

Sunny Brisbane will have a minimum of eight degrees and a maximum of 21.

There is some rain still forecast for Perth, which will range between eight and 16 degrees.

Adelaide will run the gamut from nine to 15 degrees, and Hobart from three to 12 degrees.

Darwin is once again the only well-warmed capital, with forecast temperatures of 20 to 31 degrees.
